title: A magical stay
likereview: This special occasion stay met nearly all our expectations. I was accompanying my parents, who were celebrating my mother's 80th birthday, their 60th wedding anniversary and visiting family in London. My thanks to Hiu & her manager for making the effort to changing our rooms to a higher floor, and for the lovely card & little treat for the special occasion. A shoutout to Nikka, Ashley, Vadim, Maria, & Ainar who always greeted us with genuine smiles and truly made us feel at home. The setting was lovely and we appreciated the spacious rooms and bathrooms (the family room was perfect for an elderly couple during a five-night stay, and my double room overlooking Marylebone Station was just lovely). The hotel was an oasis of tranquility after a day out and about and all the food we ate there was tasty and convenient (breakfast in the atrium, light lunches on the mezzanine terrace, and a late dinner in the bar).  Pricey, of course, but we left satisfied at this special treat.
dislikereview: None of these points were show-stoppers but addressing them would make any stay here a perfect experience: there aren't any outlets next to the beds; there is only instant coffee & a tea kettle, whereas other hotels of this caliber usually offer nespresso machines, too; the family room didn't have towel racks in the bathroom, which was inconvenient when bathing/showering, and there was only one light switch for such a large bathroom.  On a separate note, a few times the front desk seemed short-staffed, despite several large events that were happening during our stay. The breakfast buffet is only served on the weekends; during the week you need to choose a hot dish off the menu, which some might find limiting.
